subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... I don t understand this. As setUp is called before every test, it obviously doesn t then execute the actual test should the setUp fail. So, what are you
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> And while we're at
> it, have JUnit not run any test in this class and subclasses when
> this happens.

I don't understand this. As setUp is called before every test, it obviously
doesn't then execute the actual test should the setUp fail. So, what are you
getting at?

Confused, Ilja
